content:
ArrayPrototype Class

In this Article

Provides static methods and properties for ArrayObject objects. All methods of this class are called by passing in a reference to the object that is requesting access to the method. This class belongs to the built-in object model category.

Syntax

Declaration

public class ArrayPrototype : Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • ScriptObject
  • JSObject
  • Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject
  • ArrayPrototype

Properties summary

constructor

Gets a reference to a prototype-based object that is using this prototype.

Methods summary

concat(Object,VsaEngine,Object[])

Concatenates objects or arrays to the end of the specified object or array.
join(Object,Object)

Concatenates the elements of the specified array into a string. The elements are separated by the specified separator.
pop(Object)

Removes the last element from the specified array and returns it.
push(Object,Object[])

Adds new elements to the end of the specified array.
reverse(Object)

Reverses the elements of the specified array.
shift(Object)

Removes the first element from the specified array and returns it. Shifts the remaining elements to the previous positions.
slice(Object,VsaEngine,Double,Object)

Creates a new array that contains the specified consecutive elements from the specified array.
sort(Object,Object)

Sorts the elements of the specified array by using the specified function to compare the elements.
splice(Object,VsaEngine,Double,Double,Object[])

Adds and removes elements from an array at the specified position in the array. You can add elements, remove elements, or both.
toLocaleString(Object)

Creates a string representation of the specified object that concatenates the elements and separates them with a stem.Globalization.TextInfo.ListSeparator* and a space.
toString(Object)

Creates a string representation of the specified object that concatenates the elements and separates them with a comma.
unshift(Object,Object[])

Adds new elements to the start of the specified array. Shifts the existing elements to the next positions.

Properties

  • constructor

    Gets a reference to a prototype-based object that is using this prototype.

    public static Microsoft.JScript.ArrayConstructor constructor { get; }

    Property Value

    • ArrayConstructor

      A reference to a prototype-based object.

Methods

  • concat(Object,VsaEngine,Object[])

    Concatenates objects or arrays to the end of the specified object or array.

    public static Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject concat (object thisob, Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.VsaEngine engine, object[] args);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    • engine
      VsaEngine

      A reference to the scripting engine.

    • args
      Object[]

      The objects or arrays to append to thisob.

    Returns

    • Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject

      thisob and args concatenated.

  • join(Object,Object)

    Concatenates the elements of the specified array into a string. The elements are separated by the specified separator.

    public static string join (object thisob, object separator);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    • separator
      Object

      The string to use to separate the elements. The default is a comma.

    Returns

    • String

      A string that concatenates the elements of thisob.

  • pop(Object)

    Removes the last element from the specified array and returns it.

    public static object pop (object thisob);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    Returns

    • Object

      The last element of thisob.

  • push(Object,Object[])

    Adds new elements to the end of the specified array.

    public static long push (object thisob, object[] args);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    • args
      Object[]

      The elements to add to thisob.

    Returns

    • Int64

      The new length of thisob.

  • reverse(Object)

    Reverses the elements of the specified array.

    public static object reverse (object thisob);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    Returns

    • Object

      thisob.

  • shift(Object)

    Removes the first element from the specified array and returns it. Shifts the remaining elements to the previous positions.

    public static object shift (object thisob);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    Returns

    • Object

      The first element of thisob.

  • slice(Object,VsaEngine,Double,Object)

    Creates a new array that contains the specified consecutive elements from the specified array.

    public static Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject slice (object thisob, Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.VsaEngine engine, double start, object end);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    • engine
      VsaEngine

      A reference to the scripting engine.

    • start
      Double

      The first consecutive element to get.

    • end
      Object

      The last consecutive element to get.

    Returns

    • Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject

      A new array that contains the consecutive elements between thisob[start] and thisob[end].

  • sort(Object,Object)

    Sorts the elements of the specified array by using the specified function to compare the elements.

    public static object sort (object thisob, object function);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    • function
      Object

      The function to use to compare elements.

    Returns

    • Object

      thisob.

  • splice(Object,VsaEngine,Double,Double,Object[])

    Adds and removes elements from an array at the specified position in the array. You can add elements, remove elements, or both.

    public static Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject splice (object thisob, Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.VsaEngine engine, double start, double deleteCnt, object[] args);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    • engine
      VsaEngine

      A reference to the scripting engine.

    • start
      Double

      The position in the array to add and remove elements.

    • deleteCnt
      Double

      The number of elements to remove, if any.

    • args
      Object[]

      The elements to add, if any.

    Returns

    • Microsoft.JScript.ArrayObject

      A new array that contains the elements removed from thisob, if any have been removed.

  • toLocaleString(Object)

    Creates a string representation of the specified object that concatenates the elements and separates them with a stem.Globalization.TextInfo.ListSeparator* and a space.

    public static string toLocaleString (object thisob);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    Returns

    • String

      A string that concatenates the elements of thisob and separates them with a stem.Globalization.TextInfo.ListSeparator* and a space.

  • toString(Object)

    Creates a string representation of the specified object that concatenates the elements and separates them with a comma.

    public static string toString (object thisob);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    Returns

    • String

      A string that concatenates the elements of thisob and separates them with a comma.

  • unshift(Object,Object[])

    Adds new elements to the start of the specified array. Shifts the existing elements to the next positions.

    public static object unshift (object thisob, object[] args);

    Parameters

    • thisob
      Object

      The object that this method is acting upon.

    • args
      Object[]

      The elements to add to thisob.

    Returns

    • Object

      The new length of thisob.
